newsitem.title: EGYPT: Sudanese general defects to rebels - opposition.
newsitem.headline: Sudanese general defects to rebels - opposition.

text.p: The Sudanese opposition said on Wednesday a Sudanese general and some of his men had joined the rebel forces in their fight against the Islamist government.

"We welcome Major General Ali Seddique, commander of the second infantry brigade ... with some of his forces yesterday (Tuesday) evening joining the National Democratic Alliance forces," the NDA said in a statement.

The opposition group said the general defected near the town of Khashm al-Girba, some 400 km (250 miles) east of Khartoum. It did not say how many soldiers defected with him and the report could not confirmed independently.
In January the Sudanese opposition forces launched an offensive along Sudan's eastern borders. They said they hoped this would provoke a popular uprising in Khartoum.
The fighting appears to have reached stalemate and the rebels continue to hold at least two Sudanese towns close to the Sudanese-Ethiopian border.
